body:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2877190/Teenage-Little-Pony-fan-posted-heartbreaking-YouTube...

Things like this happen all the time. It doesn't matter if you're bullying someone over the Internet because you can see there's something wrong with them or because they made one comment you didn't like, either way there's a person behind that screen, just like you. And if they do anything to hurt themselves or worse, if you made a comment then you are partly responsible for what happens and if it's serious enough could face legal action. So please don't be an idiot. This isn't aimed at anyone, I'm not saying any one of you would do this... This is just a reminder that the Internet isn't all a happy place where you can have fun, have a laugh and make friends... some people could be very sensitive over something which is said to them. So think before you start bullying someone, cause before you know it it could be too late to say sorry. Thanks.
R.I.P Adam Smith :(

You're right there, but he didn't really care because he thought the trolls didn't know or care that he told someone in real life since they're behind a screen possibly thousands of miles.

I think we need a fear factor kind of thing. If someone hurts or kills themselves because of a large group of people hating on him, then every individual who wrote an offensive comment should have their IP tracked and they should have their broadband access taken away or something. People can, quite literally in this case, get away with murder on the Internet. R.I.P Adam <3 all hope goes out to family, friends, and even the bulliers. for them to relies what they've done wrong and help as many people as possible stay away from bullying and to fight against it with us. Not with it.

They are never going to escape the guilt that they have for this. Sometimes bullying is more then just saying mean things to someone or pushing them a little bit. Bullying kills people. A LOT. R.I.P Adam <3 all hope goes out to family, friends, and even the bulliers. for them to relies what they've done wrong and help as many people as possible stay away from bullying and to fight against it with us. Not with it.
